availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Pherigo (Garrard County, Kentucky, constable and farmer)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, constable and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth J. Hardin Pherigo in Garrard County, Kentucky, in January 1843. Father of Mary E. Pherigo, James R. Pherigo, William T. Pherigo, George R. Pherigo, John L. Pherigo, and Bruce H. Pherigo. Constable in Garrard County in 1850. Farmer in Garrard County in 1860. Employed Charles G. Brooks as a farmhand in Garrard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Division 1, p. 224A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 757.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Crab Orchard, p. 26A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Garrard County Marriages, 1797-1861, Film #000183256, p. 23.
"Benjamin Franklin Pherigo (1817-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial #63094034, accessed November 04, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63094034.
